sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube with a side length of 5 centimeters?
message_2:
A sphere inscribed in a cube touches all the faces of the cube. Therefore, the diameter of the sphere is equal to the side length of the cube. In this case, the diameter of the sphere is 5 centimeters. The radius of the sphere is half of the diameter, so the radius is 2.5 centimeters.

The formula for the volume of a sphere is given by:

V = (4/3)πr³

Where V is the volume, π is a mathematical constant (approximately 3.14159), and r is the radius of the sphere.

Substituting the given radius into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(2.5)³

V = (4/3)π(15.625)

V ≈ 65.45 cubic centimeters

The volume of the sphere inscribed in the cube is approximately 65.45 cubic centimeters.
